column4: hello guys, I have a problem in synaptic, whe I install: fiaif, it writes me: ' E: fiaif: subprocess post-installation script returned error exit status 1 ' what should I do?
that is an error with the package somewhere.  the rest of the error might tell you what to do, that that line is useless.  Use pastebin (see topic)
even foe Kde it makes me this error
that error says "there has been an error".  It is the bit before that that tells you the useful things.
highlight it with the mouse, then use the middle mouse button to paste it into the web form at the pastebin
rhank you : here is the paste:http://rafb.net/paste/results/mFfx1Z19.html
that suggests something else is doing things with the config dat file; reboot the computer (or if you know what it might be, close that app - e.g. aptitude in a terminal?)
Ive made End Session, doesnt it need to vlose everything??
this what it writes is apt-get:   http://rafb.net/paste/results/wu4d9n50.html
there may be some applications which are not part of your X session
ok SO ILL MAKE A RESTART AND ILL BE BACK
type "which lsof" - if you have that, then try "lsof | grep /var/cache/debconf/config.dat"
to type in the terminal: lsof | grep /var/cache/debconf/config.dat?
type: which lsof
which lsof
? i didnt understand
type lsof | grep /var/cache/debconf/config.dat
dpkg-reco 10487       root    4rW     REG       22,3   65055     608119 /var/cache/debconf/config.dat
oh - looks like something went wrong when it was trying to reconfigure some modules, and it left the process hanging.
so i need to close th process?
you could try killing it (kill 10487) - but I would recommend a reboot because I don't know what else is happening with it.
OK thank you very much i will reboot it now
